segment.source: description: Windows supports free apps, app trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products.
segment.target: description: Windows supports free apps, app trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products.

segment.source: title: Monetize your app
segment.target: title: Monetize your app

segment.source: Monetize your app
segment.target: Monetize your app

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Windows supports free apps, app trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products.
segment.target: Windows supports free apps, app trials (both time-based and feature-based), paid apps, and in-app products.

segment.source: Your Windows app can use these features to let your customers try your app for free and choose what works for them.
segment.target: Your Windows app can use these features to let your customers try your app for free and choose what works for them.

segment.source: The topics in this section show you how to build these features into your app.
segment.target: The topics in this section show you how to build these features into your app.

segment.source: For details about the fees charged by the Windows Store and how you get paid for the money your app makes, see Getting paid.
segment.target: For details about the fees charged by the Windows Store and how you get paid for the money your app makes, see Getting paid.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Exclude or limit features in a trial version
segment.target: Exclude or limit features in a trial version

segment.source: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.
segment.target: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.

segment.source: Determine which features should be limited before you begin coding, then make sure that your app only allows them to work when a full license has been purchased.
segment.target: Determine which features should be limited before you begin coding, then make sure that your app only allows them to work when a full license has been purchased.

segment.source: You can also enable features, such as banners or watermarks, that are shown only during the trial, before a customer buys your app.
segment.target: You can also enable features, such as banners or watermarks, that are shown only during the trial, before a customer buys your app.

segment.source: Enable in-app product purchases
segment.target: Enable in-app product purchases

segment.source: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.
segment.target: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.

segment.source: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.
segment.target: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.

segment.source: Add ads to apps with Microsoft Advertising
segment.target: Add ads to apps with Microsoft Advertising

segment.source: Make more money from your Windows apps by including video and banner ads from Microsoft Advertising.
segment.target: Make more money from your Windows apps by including video and banner ads from Microsoft Advertising.

segment.source: The ads show in Windows apps for PCs, tablets, and phones.
segment.target: The ads show in Windows apps for PCs, tablets, and phones.

segment.source: You can monitor your ad performance in real time by using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: You can monitor your ad performance in real time by using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Use ad mediation to maximize revenue
segment.target: Use ad mediation to maximize revenue

segment.source: Microsoft provides support for ad mediation, which lets you optimize your in-app advertising revenue by mediating banner ad requests from multiple ad networks.
segment.target: Microsoft provides support for ad mediation, which lets you optimize your in-app advertising revenue by mediating banner ad requests from multiple ad networks.

segment.source: Different ad networks may have their own strengths, with some having a higher cost per thousand views (eCPM) or higher fill rate (percentage of ads served when your app makes a request) in certain markets than others.
segment.target: Different ad networks may have their own strengths, with some having a higher cost per thousand views (eCPM) or higher fill rate (percentage of ads served when your app makes a request) in certain markets than others.

segment.source: With a single ad network, you may end up with unfilled ad requests, causing you to lose potential revenue.
segment.target: With a single ad network, you may end up with unfilled ad requests, causing you to lose potential revenue.

segment.source: Ad mediation helps you maximize your ad monetization by making sure you are always showing a live ad.
segment.target: Ad mediation helps you maximize your ad monetization by making sure you are always showing a live ad.

segment.source: View and grant products from a service
segment.target: View and grant products from a service

segment.source: If you have a catalog of apps and in-app products (IAPs), you can use the Windows Store collection API and Windows Store purchase API to access ownership information for these products from your services.
segment.target: If you have a catalog of apps and in-app products (IAPs), you can use the Windows Store collection API and Windows Store purchase API to access ownership information for these products from your services.
